meanings.definition: An instrument that measures and records the humidity in the atmosphere.
meanings.sent1: The hygrographs in the weather station help us track how humid it is outside.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use hygrographs to study the moisture levels in the air.
meanings.sent3: The hygrographs at the lab had a dance party when the humidity spiked.
meanings.sent4: The hygrographs whispered secrets of the atmosphere's moisture to the researchers.
meanings.sent5: The hygrographs hummed softly as they diligently recorded the humidity changes.

meanings.definition: The data collected by a hygrograph.
meanings.sent1: The hygrographs' data showed a sudden increase in humidity overnight.
meanings.sent2: Analyzing the hygrographs' information helped predict the upcoming rain.
meanings.sent3: The hygrographs' data decided to play hide-and-seek with the researchers.
meanings.sent4: The hygrographs' numbers painted a vivid picture of the humidity trends.
meanings.sent5: The hygrographs' data danced across the screen, revealing the moisture patterns.

meanings.definition: To monitor humidity levels using a hygrograph.
meanings.sent1: We will hygrographs the greenhouse to ensure the plants get enough moisture.
meanings.sent2: She hygrographs regularly to keep track of the humidity changes.
meanings.sent3: The researchers hygrographs the lab every morning, like clockwork.
meanings.sent4: He hygrographs the room with precision, noting even the slightest humidity shift.
meanings.sent5: They hygrographs diligently, ensuring accurate humidity readings for the experiment.
